Package de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.scenario

Defines interfaces for the scenario and its factory.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Builder Another way (than to implement Configurable or Composable interface) to configure simulator modules from an XML file: here, the configurator will pass the control to the builder which in turn can build objects from the XML data.
Composable An implementation of this interface indicates that it requires other configurables in order to configure itself properly.
Configurable This is a marker interface for so-called configurables - classes which can be configured via the configuration mechanism.
Configurator An implementation of this interface is used to access and probably parse the file describing the configuration of the simulator.
HostBuilder HostBuilder is used to parse a portion of the configuration file and to build hosts based on it.
Scenario Scenario configures hosts to make them usable for simulator, i.e.
ScenarioAction Represents an action which can be specified in the action file and will be used to pre-initialize the simulator queue.
ScenarioFactory Right way to create a scenario is to use a factory extending this interface.
 

Exception Summary
ConfigurationException Thrown if the simulator was not configured properly.
 

Package de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.scenario Description

Defines interfaces for the scenario and its factory.
